heroIntro: Welcome to the golfer's gateway to Costa Blanca living. This 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment in Pueblo, Algorfa offers the perfect base for active golf enthusiasts seeking authentic Spanish lifestyle without the inflated coastal price tag. At €164,425, you're acquiring a premium-specification home at €2,530/m² – a remarkable 50% discount compared to beachfront towns just 20 minutes away. Set within the La Finca Golf resort community, this property puts you steps from championship courses and a thriving international golf community where English is spoken throughout. The apartment's 65m² layout maximises comfort with modern finishes, ideal for golfers looking for a vacation retreat, long-term residence, or smart investment. Algorfa itself has experienced 12% year-on-year appreciation, while typical rental yields reach €900 per week – making this both a lifestyle choice and a sound financial decision. Whether you're planning your retirement around fairways or seeking a second home with genuine investment potential, this apartment combines affordability, location, and golf-centric amenities in one compelling package.
areaSection: Algorfa is a charming inland village in the Vega Baja region of Alicante Province, positioned strategically between the Costa Blanca beaches and the rolling interior landscapes. This whitewashed pueblo maintains authentic Spanish character while hosting a substantial international community drawn by proximity to multiple championship golf courses. The climate is Mediterranean with warm, dry summers and mild winters – perfect for year-round golfing. Algorfa sits at approximately 60 metres elevation, offering cleaner air than coastal towns and remarkable value for property investment. The village has evolved thoughtfully around golf tourism, with La Finca Golf anchoring the community, yet it retains local charm with family-run restaurants, weekly markets, and genuine Spanish hospitality. Located just 45 minutes from Alicante International Airport and 15 minutes from beautiful Guardamar beaches, Algorfa occupies an enviable middle ground – close enough to amenities and transport, far enough inland to avoid coastal development pressures and price premiums.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Algorfa revolves around the golf calendar and an active expatriate community united by shared passions. Morning rounds at La Finca Golf or neighbouring Lo Romero courses start your day, followed by coffee at the clubhouse where English conversations flow naturally among British, Dutch, and Scandinavian residents. Afternoons might involve beach visits to Guardamar or La Mata – just 15-20 minutes by car – where you'll find golden sand, chiringuitos serving fresh seafood, and water sports. Evenings showcase traditional Spanish dining at local restaurants in the village square, where international homeowners mix with Spanish families over paella and local wines. The expat infrastructure is exceptional: English-speaking healthcare professionals, international schools within 25 minutes, and regular social events organised through golf clubs. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona in nearby Rojales (10 minutes) and larger centres in Torrevieja (20 minutes). Healthcare access is reassuring with Hospital de Torrevieja's modern facilities nearby and English-speaking doctors throughout the region. This is active, social living – not retirement isolation, but an integrated community of golf-loving adventurers.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Algorfa provides surprising amenity density for a village of 6,000 residents. Infrastructure supports daily living comprehensively: healthcare, education, shopping, and transport all accessible within 20 minutes. The international golf community has elevated local services significantly.

healthcare.text: Healthcare access is a genuine strength. Hospital de Torrevieja – a modern private facility with English-speaking doctors – sits 20 minutes by car and handles everything from routine appointments to complex procedures. The village maintains a local health centre for minor ailments and prescription refills. Algorfa's expatriate community has driven competitive healthcare quality, with multiple English-speaking GPs established in the area. Dental services, physiotherapy (important for golfers), and specialist consultants are readily available. Spain's healthcare system is excellent and affordable, with private coverage optional. Many residents maintain both Spanish healthcare cards and international insurance for peace of mind.

shopping.text: Daily shopping is convenient without requiring supermarket chains. The village maintains traditional Spanish grocery shops, bakeries, and butchers providing fresh local products. Mercadona supermarket in nearby Rojales (10 minutes) stocks international foods, wines, and household essentials at reasonable prices. Larger shopping centres in Torrevieja (20 minutes) include Carrefour and El Corte Inglés for extensive selections. Weekly markets in village squares offer fresh produce, clothing, and household goods at local prices. Specialist golf shops are accessible through resort amenities. Internet shopping via Amazon Spain and local platforms supplements physical retail effectively.

transport.text: A car is essential in Algorfa – public transport is limited despite bus connections to Torrevieja. This is characteristic of inland Costa Blanca communities where distances make personal transportation practical. Alicante International Airport (45 minutes) offers flights across Europe, supporting the international community effectively. Driving to beaches, golf courses, and larger towns is straightforward via well-maintained Spanish motorways and local roads. Parking is plentiful and free throughout the region. For UK residents, driving to France via ferry is feasible (24-hour drive), and the pan-European road network connects efficiently.

faqs.question: Can non-Spanish citizens buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes – Spain welcomes non-resident foreign buyers. EU citizens require only NIE numbers (tax identification). Non-EU buyers follow identical processes with additional documentation. Mortgages are available to foreigners at competitive rates (3-4%). Legal representation by qualified Spanish solicitors ensures compliance and transaction security. No residency requirement exists for property ownership.
